On this page, you will find resources associated with each session in the advanced-track coding workshop (<a href="https://columbiauniversity.zoom.us/j/96821508904?pwd=U25kdlpienRheFlyMmhKaU9JOFF1Zz09" target="_blank">zoom link</a>, pw: sipps2021).
<br><br>
A few days before each session, please check this page to make sure you've downloaded any necessary files in advance (if needed). After each session, the page will be updated with links to the corresponding zoom recording, as well as any additional materials/answer keys/etc. that were referenced during the workshop.
<hr>

### Week 1: Refresher of regression and moderation (frequentist)
<br>
<div align="center"><a href="https://columbiauniversity.zoom.us/rec/share/IP1_-EPWLHypgEt_krGjQVl5AvQzMh0YREqO460fACXVAYk-A2-t9ECSxK7eQNMl.PUsxRULkO2eFmvAH" target="_blank" style="padding-bottom:10px"><button><i class="fas fa-video"></i>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;View Recording</button></a></div>
<br>
**Before the workshop:**
<ul>
<li>make sure you have both R and RStudio downloaded on your machine; if you don't, check out [this page](https://cu-psych-computing.github.io/cu-psych-comp-tutorial/tutorials/r-core/1-programming/lessonpart0/#working-with-rstudio-1){target="_blank"} for guidance
</ul>
<br>
**Workshop materials:**
<ul>
<li>R packages used today: `tidyverse` (contains `ggplot2`, `dplyr`, and others); `car`
<li><a href="/workshop_files/coding-adv-01/lm-intro.pdf" download>intro to regression slides</a>
<li><a href="/workshop_files/coding-adv-01/lm-lesson.Rmd" download>RMarkdown lesson file (with notes)</a>
<li><a href="/workshop_files/coding-adv-01/lm-challenge-empty.Rmd" download>RMarkdown challenge file</a> / <a href="/workshop_files/coding-adv-01/lm-challenge.Rmd" download>answer key</a>
</ul>
<br>
**Note:** Please let us know if you are experiencing any issues downloading R and/or installing packages! We also welcome any and all conceptual questions about linear regression, using the `lm()` function, etc.
